Package org.blockchainnative.annotations

Annotation Type ContractParameter

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(PARAMETER)
public @interface ContractParameter
    Adds additional metadata to the parameters of a method annotated with ContractMethod.
    Either asType() or useTypeConverter(), but not both fields are intended to be set.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ContractWrapperGenerator

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.Class<?> asType
      Instructs to underlying provider to convert the annotated parameter to the following type before calling the contract method.
      java.lang.Class<? extends TypeConverter<?,?>> useTypeConverter
      Instructs to underlying provider to convert the annotated parameter using the specified type converter before calling the contract method.

    • Element Detail

      • asType

        java.lang.Class<?> asType
        Instructs to underlying provider to convert the annotated parameter to the following type before calling the contract method.
        The provider will use any matching type converter or its built-in conversion mechanism (if supported) the convert the parameter.
        If the type is not supported by the provider, a TypeConvertException is raised when calling the method.
        Void.class acts as a placeholder, meaning no special conversion is needed.

        Due to type erasure you need to use a specific type converter in order to convert to a generic type.
        Returns:
        type to convert the parameter to
        Default:
        java.lang.Void.class

      • useTypeConverter

        java.lang.Class<? extends TypeConverter<?,?>> useTypeConverter
        Instructs to underlying provider to convert the annotated parameter using the specified type converter before calling the contract method.
        If the resulting type is not supported by the provider, a TypeConvertException is raised when calling the method.
        NoOpTypeConverter.class acts as a placeholder, meaning no special conversion is needed.
        Returns:
        specific type converter class to be used.
        Default:
        org.blockchainnative.convert.NoOpTypeConverter.class
